content.question: If <math alttext="a, sub n, is greater than 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>a</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>n</mi></mrow></msub><mo>></mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> for all <math alttext="n" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>n</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="the limit as n approaches infinity, of, the fraction with numerator a, sub n plus 1, end subscript, and denominator a, sub n, end fraction, equals 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><munder><mrow><mi>lim</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>n</mi><mo>→</mo><mi>∞</mi></mrow></munder><mfrac><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>a</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>n</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub></mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>a</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>n</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, which of the following series converges?

choices.label: <math alttext="the sum, from n equals 1, to infinity, of a, sub n" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mrow><munderover><mo>∑</mo><mrow><mi>n</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>∞</mi></mrow></munderover><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>a</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>n</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the sum, from n equals 1, to infinity, of, the fraction with numerator a, sub n, and denominator n to the fifth power, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mrow><munderover><mo>∑</mo><mrow><mi>n</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>∞</mi></mrow></munderover><mrow><mfrac><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>a</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>n</mi></mrow></msub></mrow><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>n</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the sum, from n equals 1, to infinity, of, the fraction with numerator a, sub n, and denominator 5 to the n power, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mrow><munderover><mo>∑</mo><mrow><mi>n</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>∞</mi></mrow></munderover><mrow><mfrac><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>a</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>n</mi></mrow></msub></mrow><mrow><msup><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>n</mi></mrow></msup></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the sum, from n equals 1, to infinity, of, the fraction with numerator open parenthesis, a, sub n, close parenthesis, squared, and denominator 5 to the n power, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><munderover><mo>∑</mo><mrow><mi>n</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>∞</mi></mrow></munderover><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><msub><mrow><mi>a</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>n</mi></mrow></msub><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><msup><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>n</mi></mrow></msup></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="the sum, from n equals 1, to infinity, of, the fraction with numerator a, sub n, and denominator 5 to the n power, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mrow><munderover><mo>∑</mo><mrow><mi>n</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>∞</mi></mrow></munderover><mrow><mfrac><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>a</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>n</mi></mrow></msub></mrow><mrow><msup><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>n</mi></mrow></msup></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

skill.text: Skill 3.D: Apply an appropriate mathematical definition, theorem, or test.
